s: ^Who are you? Are you the rabbit who led me down here?

c-0: ^She thinks all rabbits are the same! Shame, shame.
c-1: ^It’s not very polite not to introduce yourself.

s: ^It’s not very polite not to answer my question.

g-0: ^It’s not very polite of you not to remember us.
^You told me I should remember you! Shouldn’t you at least know if we’ve met?

s: ^This is going in circles. Who are you?
^Would you please just tell me where I am?

c-0: ^Shouldn't you ask where it is you meet the people you are meeting? So rude without a greeting. I am the Hatter.

s: ^Well, it’s nice to meet you, Mr. Hatter. I am Alice.

c-0: ^It’s not all that nice to meet you, Alice. You seem like a rather rude child.
^That's not very kind! I've done nothing to you!
^It’s not very polite of you to lie either! You’ve asked me many questions, as if you didn’t do this very thing!
c-1: ^It’s rude to call someone names. How would you feel if I called you Mad Alice?
^Mad Alice, too concerned with politeness to be polite! No room! No room for you to sit.
^I should know the people who have done me wrong! Only a child lacking such manners would throw me out of wonderland!
^Shouldn't the knower know the things asked by the asker? You ought to know the things that you have done!

Suspects: ^Well, if YOU haven’t done anything, then I suppose our Queen of Hearts may know the cards in the deck! How absurd… and you haven’t even sat for tea!

c-0: ^Forwards, I imagine! Never backwards, unless backwards was your forwards, but then, you’d have gone about the whole thing all wrong. And its quite wrong to be wrong when you haven't even sat for tea!
c-1: ^It’s quite rude to stand while others sit.
g-0: ^There isn't time for tea! I must find the queen!
^Then I suppose you must leave this room. But always on a different path than before, lest your destination remain in befuddlement! Inquire with me again if the doors give you trouble.
